uientry.s:
local this = UIComponent(Address)
function ShowMenu(name) for i = 0, this:ChildCount() - 1 do local child = UIComponent(this:Find(i)) child:SetVisible(child:Id() == name) end end

uientry.unicode: Any green areas on this map show the regions that the selected nation already controls.||This is important to know when choosing which nation to play as, as it will affect how you develop your empire.||Have a look at the other theatres - America and India - to see other regions the selected nation may own.

Any green areas on this map show the regions that the selected nation already controls.||This is important to know when choosing which nation to play as, as it will affect how you develop your empire.||Have a look at the other theatres - Europe and India - to see other regions the selected nation may own.

Any green areas on this map show the regions that the selected nation already controls.||This is important to know when choosing which nation to play as, as it will affect how you develop your empire.||Have a look at the other theatres - America and Europe - to see other regions the selected nation may own.
These flags represent the playable nations.||Clicking on any of these flags will select that nation, and change the faction details accordingly.
Your selected nation and the start year of the grand campaign.||To select another nation select one of the other flags above.
This is the leader for this nation.
Your selected nation and the start year of the grand campaign.||To select another nation select one of the other flags above.

uientry.s:
local parent = UIComponent(UIComponent(Address):Parent(3))
function OnSelect() parent:LuaCall("SelectOption", Address) end

uientry.unicode: Here you can see the overall difficulty of your nation and set the individual difficulty settings for your campaign and battle maps.
You can increase or decrease campaign difficulty with the slider.
You can increase or decrease battle difficulty with the slider.
Change settings such as advisor help and battle time limit here.||You can change these settings at any time during the campaign on the Game Settings panel.

This panel gives you a historic context for your campaign and offers hints and tips on how to proceed.||Each nation will have its own advice to offer according to its tactical location and its potential for expansion.

uientry.s: function UpdateSlider() local value = Component.GetProperty("Parent.Value") - Component.GetProperty("stepSize") Component.SetProperty("Parent.Value", value) Component.Call("Parent.LuaCall", "Update") end

function UpdateSlider() local value = Component.GetProperty("Parent.Value") + Component.GetProperty("stepSize") Component.SetProperty("Parent.Value", value) Component.Call("Parent.LuaCall", "Update") end

uientry.unicode: Select settings for your grand campaign here.||You can change these settings at any time during the campaign on the Game Settings panel.

Check this box to receive gameplay tips from the in-game advisor.||The advisor will appear in the top left-hand of the screen.||If this is your first time playing the game, it is probably a good idea to have the advisor on.

Check this box to receive gameplay tips from the in-game advisor.||The advisor will appear in the top left-hand of the screen.||If this is your first time playing the game, it is probably a good idea to have the advisor on.

If this is checked, visible CPU player's moves will be shown during the end turn phase.||This can help to keep a track on some of the CPU's locations and movements, but the end turn phase will also take longer.

If this is checked, visible CPU player's moves will be shown during the end turn phase.||This can help to keep a track on some of the CPU's locations and movements, but the end turn phase will also take longer.
If this box is checked, taxes and construction will be automatically managed.||This will free you up to concentrate on other areas of the game.
If this box is checked, taxes and construction will be automatically managed.||This will free you up to concentrate on other areas of the game.

uientry.s:
function OnSelect() local this = UIComponent(Address) local panel = UIComponent(this:Parent("main_panel"))
panel:LuaCall("AcceptAdvancedOptions") end

function OnSelect() local this = UIComponent(Address) local panel = UIComponent(this:Parent("main_panel"))
panel:LuaCall("CancelAdvancedOptions") end

uientry.unicode: Check this box to impose a time limit on battles played on the battlemap.||Once checked, the time limit choices will appear below.
Check this box to impose a time limit on battles played on the battlemap.||Once checked, the time limit choices will appear below.
To win the grand campaign you must complete these objectives within the time limit given.||As you play through the grand campaign you will be given tips on how to achieve these conditions.

uientry.s: function UpdateSlider() local value = Component.GetProperty("Parent.Value") - Component.GetProperty("stepSize") Component.SetProperty("Parent.Value", value) Component.Call("Parent.LuaCall", "Update") end

function UpdateSlider() local value = Component.GetProperty("Parent.Value") + Component.GetProperty("stepSize") Component.SetProperty("Parent.Value", value) Component.Call("Parent.LuaCall", "Update") end

function InitState(state) Component.Call("Resize", Component.Call("Width"), state.Text.DisplayHeight) Component.Call("Parent.LuaCall", "SetTextExtents", state.Text.DisplayWidth, state.Text.DisplayHeight) end

local parent = UIComponent(UIComponent(Address):Parent(3))
function OnSelect() parent:LuaCall("SelectOption", Address) end

uientry.unicode: On this screen you can select your nation, battle and campaign difficulty and see victory conditions vital to winning the campaign.||Move your cursor over the different areas below to see more information.

uientry.s:
function OnSelect() local this = UIComponent(Address) local panel = UIComponent(this:Parent("grand_campaign"))
panel:LuaCall("StartCampaign") end
